title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Azul Portugal White (Palmela)
description: This blend of Arinto and Fernão Pires is soft and bland. Its light fruit and acidity feel open and ripe.

title: Domaine de Grange Neuve 2015 La Fleur Lily  (Bergerac Rosé)
description: This is a soft rosé with ripe strawberry fruits and light acidity. A Bordeaux-style blend of the two Cabernets and a dominance of Merlot has produced a caramel and fruit-flavored wine that is ready to drink.

title: Domaine de Grange Neuve 2015 La Fleur Lily Semi-Sweet White (Côtes de Bergerac)
description: The wine is soft and fruity with hints of honey as well as mango and peach flavors. It is lightly perfumed leaving room for a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Domaine de l'Herré 2015 La Galope Rosé (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: This is a soft wine that has plenty of red-berry fruits, bright acidity and a light fruity texture. It is dry although the softness gives it an apparent sweetness. Drink now.

title: Casa Montes 2014 Ampakama Syrah (San Juan)
description: Wiry herbal aromas of blueberry and currant lead to an acidic citrusy palate that's choppy and a bit rough. Quick-hitting plum and currant flavors are herbal before hollowing out on a zesty, tannic finish.

title: Acacia 2014 Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)
description: Reduced and dominated by tannin and oak, this large production offering is earthy and spicy, with full-bodied texture and weight. It finishes slightly green.

title: EOS 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Vague apple, pear and lime pith aromas show on the subdued nose of this bottling. The palate is pleasant, with dried apple, lime peel and grass flavors, but it's somewhat lacking in energy.

title: Spann Vineyards 2012 The Classic Four Red (Sonoma County)
description: Cherry and cassis notes provide a touch of brighness on the nose and palate of this blend of 40% Cabernet Sauvignon, 28% Cabernet Franc, 26% Petit Verdot and 6% Malbec, but its plum-raisin backdrop and dullness on the finish suggest it might be going downhill.

title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2015 Terra de Touros Arinto (Tejo)
description: This is a soft and crisp wine that shows attractive, tangy orange flavor and has plenty of acidity to keep it as fresh as possible. Drink now.

title: Vicente Faria Vinhos 2015 Animus Red (Douro)
description: This is a soft, fruity and easy wine. With simple tannins and black currant fruit laced with spice, it's made to be drunk now.

title: Gen Del Alma 2016 Ji Ji Ji Finca Villa Seca Gen Fuerza Tranquila Chenin Blanc (Tupungato)
description: Low-intensity apple and pear aromas lead to a tight high-acid mouth. Severe flavors of lemon and lime are fairly sour. A long direct finish is linear and shearing.
designation: Ji Ji Ji Finca Villa Seca Gen Fuerza Tranquila

title: Casarena 2014 505 Esencia Red (Mendoza)
description: Floral berry and plum aromas are also saucy and oaky, and thus discordant. A wobbly tannic palate with green herbal oaky blueberry flavors tastes grassy on the finish. If you know Casarena's wines, this fits the mold.

title: Caves Campelo 2015 Campelo Tinto Red (Vinho Verde)
description: High-acid red wine is not for everyone, but this one—dry, stalky and light—is a genuine example of a wine that has always had a following in northern Portugal, great for pairing with fresh sardines. Think that way, and it's more than just a curiosity.

title: Caves Campelo 2015 Casal da Seara White (Vinho Verde)
description: Soft, light and fruity, this wine is ready for a warm day. Apple flavors and clean acidity balance its soft sweetness, making it ready to drink now. Intriguingly, its label resembles that of a much more familiar brand of Vinho Verde.

title: Waterkloof 2015 Seriously Cool Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)
description: Soft notes of straw and honeycomb grace the orange and red apple fruit tones. The mouthfeel is round and a touch flat on the midpalate, finishing with a bitter almond flavor. Drink now.

title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2015 Senses Alvarinho (Alentejano)
description: This pleasant, fruity wine has lemon-lime crispness. Hints of apricot flavor prove the Alvarinho grape is far from its northern Portuguese homeland. Drink now.

title: Antucura 2015 Malbec (Vista Flores)
description: Jammy jumbled foxy aromas set up a blocky flat palate. Greasy flavors of buttered-up berry fruits finish without much verve. This is good enough, but just barely.

title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo NV Plexus Rosé Castelão (Tejo)
description: This sweet sparkling rosé is clean and crisp. It has attractive strawberry fruit, soft texture and a light mousse. Drink now.

title: Valentin Bianchi NV Casa Bianchi Brut Traditional Method  (Mendoza)
description: Rudimentary aromas of lemon-lime and apple set up a flat palate. This tastes of dried apricots before turning decidedly bitter. On the finish, flavors of dried white fruits are modest.

title: DeLorimier 2014 Two Pear Vineyard Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)
description: High in ripeness and intensity, this vineyard designate overpowers with astringency as it plows through a wall of blackberry jam and chocolate flavors.

title: Casarena 2013 505 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Raisiny aromas lack freshness and lift. Following that lead, this Cabernet feels stewy and heavy, with questionable balance. Herbal flavors of stewed plum and tomato finish chunky and choppy.

title: Pam's Cuties NV Unoaked Chardonnay (California)
description: Sweet and fruity, this canned wine feels soft and syrupy, with sugary pear as the primary flavor on the palate. It's a basic white wine in a convenient package.

title: Jeff Gordon 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a thin, unfussy wine that imparts bell pepper and asparagus in a sea of green flavor.

title: Mazzocco 2014 Fog Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: This soft, robustly ripe wine shows a raisin-like prune character, tasting somewhat chalky on the palate.

title: Naggiar 2015 Bellissima White (Sierra Foothills)
description: An unusual earthy, herbal character dominates the mild fruitiness and marzipan character of this medium-bodied, slightly sweet wine.

title: Fairvalley 2015 Chenin Blanc (Western Cape)
description: This is a lightly aromatic wine, with faint aromas of melon, lemon-lime and yellow flowers. The palate is soft and thin, with similarly delicate flavors as the nose. Drink now.

title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2014 Viña Temprana Old Vines Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Light plum and raspberry aromas include notes of animal and latex. This lightweight Garnacha has a monotone mouthfeel, while hollow simple berry flavors finish with acidic tang.

title: Loteta 2014 Red (Campo de Borja)
description: Herbal tomato and red-berry aromas are jumbled and fail to state much of a case for this multigrape blend. Herbal spicy tea and raspberry flavors finish jagged, with mild heat.

title: Galante 2013 Kick Ass Red (Carmel Valley)
description: Sour fruit, funky root beer, dried salami and asphalt aromas show on the nose of this rustic bottling. Dried fruit and espresso flavors mark the palate.

title: Wellington 2011 Handal-Denier Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)
description: The bell pepper, cedar and green bean notes in this wine come across as astringent and thin.
